It is one of the most promising techniques for analyses of volatile components due to its ability to facilitate the detection of trace quantities with limited sample preparation. In this technique, the sample is placed in a closed thermostated glass vial where the volatile analyte attains an equilibrium distribution between the gas and solid/liquid phase.
